speaker: Ossuary
lines: Skulls stack into arches. Jawbones make tidy shelves.
Every socket contains a shadow that might have been an idea once.
A braid of rosary beads ties a pillar; the knots are prayers against untying.
A child-sized femur serves as a candle holderâ€”wax drips like fat tears.
Your boot knocks a tibia; it rolls back obediently to where it belonged.
Some skulls grin like hostesses. Some keep their teeth to themselves.
A single hair ribbon loops a vertebra. The knot is new.
You are not the only visitor who chooses the quiet rooms.

choices.text: Whisper a litany and move on.
Pocket the ribbon and follow a fresh footprint.
Sit and let your bones rest with their cousins.
